description: Designing generative deep learning architectures for structure-guided protein design and therapeutic discovery.
Built ppIRIS, a siamese cross-attention PPI model that revealed 1,000+ novel interactions in bacterial pathogens.
Contributed to the European [[BEEGUARDS|https://beeguards.eu/]] and national [[ECOAPI|https://tinyurl.com/ecoapi]](ref. TED2021-131393B-I00) projects for the study of beekeeping and metagenomics.
Engineered scalable tools for genomics data handling, enabling automated conversion across multiple file formats common in bioinformatics workflows.
Applied predictive modeling and statistical learning to NGS datasets, identifying microbial signatures and forecasting bee colony survival.
Built and deployed interactive dashboards for research partners (Python/Plotly Dash and Tableau).
Developed and published a [[deep learning tool|https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/39/11/btad645/7325354]] for drug-resistance prediction in a high impact bioinformatics journal.
Processed and analyzed multi-omics data from over 10 public datasets and hundreds of cell lines.
Awarded a highly competitive Fundación La Caixa-funded research grant under the project LCF/PR/HP20/52300003.
Established a pipeline for the virtual screening of over 300 compounds against proteins of interest in neurodevelopment.
Assisted in the design and construction of reactors for heavy metal bioaccumulation and bioleaching assays.
Contributed to the extraction, sequencing and annotation of tens of bacterial genomes.
Screened genomic data for the identification of heavy metal-resistance genes using mathematical modelling.
Contributed to the organization of the international microbiology congress Microbiotec19.
Hosted a round table between a former ASM President and over one hundred University of Coimbra students and researchers.
